mods.abstract: $100 REWARD. RAN AWAY from the subscriber, the 7th inst., a negro man calling himself TRUMAN BERRY. He is a well known drayman for the last 15 years in this city, and will try to pass himself as a free man ; he is about 45 years of age, 5 feet 10 or 11 inches high, stout built, yellow complexion, marked with small pox, large whiskers, and he is getting gray in his beard and head ; when last heard from he was at Biscoe & Sims', where he had been at work, and a Thomas Warren's, below Poydras Market. The above reward will be paid for his apprehension and evidence sufficient to convict the person or persons harboring him ; or $25 for the recovery of the negro. H.T. WADE, 55 Tchoupitoulas st. je22 tf
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
